Original question:
A one-fiftieth scale model of a military airplane is
tested at 1020 m/s in a wind tunnel at sea-level conditions. The model wing area is 180 cm^2. The angle of
attack is 3 degrees. If the measured model lift is 860 N,
what is the prototype lift, using Mach number scaling,
when it flies at 10,000 m standard altitude under
dynamically similar conditions? Note: Be careful with
the area scaling
